gurmukhi: pw pkrXo hir kY qumry pt Aau qr pY ciV sIq shw hY ]jo hm pRym Cky AiqhI qumko hm FUFq FUMF lhw hY ]
transliteration: Paa Padaryo Har(i) Kai Toumre Pat Au Tar Pai Charttee Seet Sahaa Hai|| Jo Ham Prem Chhake At(i)hitoumko Ham Dhoodhat Dhoondh Lahaa Hai||
translation: “I have stolen your clothes and now you are enduring more cold uselessly; I am absorbed in your love and I have found you today after a great search;

gurmukhi: jor pRnwm kro hm ko kr sauh lgY qum morI hhwhY ]kwnH khI hs bwq suno suB cwr BeI qu ibcwr khw hY ]275]
transliteration: Jor Pranaam Daro Ham Ko Kar Sauh Lagad Toum Morihahaa Hai|| Kaahn Has Baat Souno Soubh Chaar Bhaitu Bichaar Kaahaa Hai||275||
translation: “Bow before me with folded hands; I tell you on oath that from today you are mine, “Krishna said smilingly, “Listen, everything has occurred on your coming out of water, why are you absorbed in more thoughts now uselessly.”275.

gurmukhi: SMk kro hm qy n kCU Aru lwj kCU jIA mY nhI kIjY ]jor pRnwm kro hm ko kr dwsn kI ibnqI suin lIjY ]
transliteration: Shank Daro Ham Te Na Kachhodh Ar(u) Laaj Kachhodh Jeeaa Mai Nahikeejai|| Jor Pranaam Daro Ham Ko Kar Daasan Kibintisoun(i) Leejai||
translation: “Do not feel shy from me and also do not have any doubt about me; I am your servant; accepting my request, bow before me with folded hands;”

gurmukhi: kwnH khI his kY iqn so qumry miRg sy diRg dyKq jIjY ]fyrn nwih krY qum ry ieh qy qumro kCU nwihn CIjY ]276]
transliteration: Kaahn Kahihas(i) Kai Tin So Toumre Mrig Se Drig Dekhat Jeejai|| Deran Naah(i) Darai Toum Re Eh Te Toumro Kachhodh Naahin Chheejai||276||
translation: Krishna said further, “I live only on seeing your doe-like eyes; do not delay, you will not lose anything by this.”276.

gurmukhi: kwnH jbY pt nw dey qb gopI sB hwr ]kwnH khY so kIjIAY kIno iehY ibcwr ]277]
transliteration: Kaahn Jabai Pat Naa Dae Tab Gopisabh Haar|| Kaahn Kahai So Keejai Keeno Ihai Bichaar||277||
translation: When Krishna did not return the clothes, then accepting defeat, the gopis decided to do whatever Krishna said.277.

gurmukhi: jor pRnwm kro hir kO kir Awpis mY kih kY muskwnI ]sXwm lgI khny muK qy sB hI gupIAw imil AMmiRq bwnI ]
transliteration: Jor Pranaam Daro Har(i) Kau Kar(i) Aapas(i) Mai Kah(i) Kai Mouskaanee|| Syaam Lagikahne Moukh Te Sah Higoupeeaa Mil(i) Anmrit Baanee||
translation: All of them smiling among themselves and uttering sweet words, began to bow before Krishna;

gurmukhi: hohu pRsMnX khXo hm pY kr bwq khI qum so hm mwnI ]AMqr nwih rhXo ieh jw Ab soaU BlI qumjo mn BwnI ]278]
transliteration: Hhoh(u) Prasannya Kahyo Ham Pai Kar Baat Kahitoum So Ham Maanee|| Antar Naah(i) Rahyo Eh Jaa Ab Sooo Bhalitoumjo Man Bhaanee||278||
translation: “O Krishna! now be pleased with us, whatsoever you want, we acceded to that, Now there is no difference between you and us whatever pleases you, is good for us.”278.

gurmukhi: kwm ky bwn bnI brCI Bruty Dn sy diRg suMdr qyry ]Awnn hY sis so Al kY hir moih rhY mn rMck hyry ]
transliteration: Kaam Ke Baan Banidarchhibdaroote Dhan Se Drig Soundar Dere|| Oonan Hai Sas(i) So Al Kai Har(i) Moh(i) Rahai Man Ranchak Dere||
translation: “Your eyebrows are like a bow, from which the arrows of lust are coming out and striking us like the dagger; the eyes are extremely beautiful, the face is like moon and the hair like a she-serpent; even if we see you a little, the mind gets infatuated;”

gurmukhi: qau qum swQ krI ibnqI jb kwm krw aupjI jIA myry ]cuMbn dyhu khXo sB hI muK sauh hmY kh hY nih fyry ]279]
transliteration: Tau Toum Saath Karibintijab Kaam Karaa Oupjijeea Dere|| Chounban Dehu Kahyo Sabh-himoukh Sauh Hamai Kah Hai Nah(i) Dere||279||
translation: Krishna said, “When the lust has arisen in my mind, therefore I had requested you all; let me kiss your faces and I swear that I shall not tell anything at home.”279.

gurmukhi: hoih pRsMnX sBY gupIAw imil mwn joaU kwnH khI hY ]joir hulws bFXo jIA mY ignqI srqw mg nyh bhI hY ]
transliteration: Hoh(i) Prasannyaa Sabhai Goupeeaa Mil(i) Maan Jooo Kaahn Kahihai|| Jor(i) Hulaas Badhyo Jeea Mia Gintisartaa Mag Neh Bahihai||
translation: The gopis accepted with pleasure all, that Krishna said the current of joy increased in their mind and the stream of love flowed;
